Title: The Best Kind of Leader ï½œ Tao Te Ching Chapter 67 Explained (Part 3)
Content: Embrace humility and restraint in leadership roles.
Avoid seeking positions of power actively; let them come naturally.
True wisdom and mastery often manifest in the absence of constant correction.
Let events unfold without interference; avoid trying to control or predict the future.
True leaders understand that they are part of a larger cosmic interplay and do not attempt to dominate it.
